channel.title: My loader :P won't start

item.title: My loader :P won't start
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:7, topic:222275”][quote author=butzie225 link=topic=291927.msg2353241#msg2353241 date=1217171103]

Be forewarned, that doing parameters.put with a static value can cause unneeded detectability, if the value that the applet needs changes, your detectable, even if slightly. It would be best, to read all the pages, and parse the values directly from the page. Also, be forewarned, that the settings value changes. I have not looked into what causes it to change, but i have seen different values for different people.

how could i make a settings parser???
[/quote]
Think and try yourself? Don’t expect anyone to spoon feed you to the max here.[/quote]This is 100% true.

Honestly, the reason I don’t tell you shit when you ask me on MSN is because you learn better if you teach yourself.

Experiment, and take a look at JavaDocs.

Read full topic

It would be best, to read all the pages, and parse the values directly from the page. Also, be forewarned, that the settings value changes. item.title: My loader :P won't start
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

Be forewarned, that doing parameters.put with a static value can cause unneeded detectability, if the value that the applet needs changes, your detectable, even if slightly. It would be best, to read all the pages, and parse the values directly from the page. Also, be forewarned, that the settings value changes. I have not looked into what causes it to change, but i have seen different values for different people.

Read full topic

item.title: My loader :P won't start
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

document.write('<param name=worldid value=100>');
document.write('<param name=members value=1>');
document.write('<param name=modewhat value=0>');
document.write('<param name=modewhere value=0>');
document.write('<param name=safemode value=0>');
document.write('<param name=lang value=0>');
document.write('<param name=affid value=0>');
document.write('<param name=settings value=kKmok3kJqOeN6D3mDdihco3oPeYN2KFy6W5--vZUbNA>');
document.write('<param name=cookieprefix value=>');
document.write('<param name=cookiehost value=.runescape.com>');
document.write('<param name=plug value=0>');
document.write('<param name=js value=1>');
document.write('<param name=game value=0>');

You don’t have all the parameters handled. Plus, why create a new HashMap with all those values every time a parameter is called? It’s a waste of memory. Just initialize the HashMap as final upon class instantiation, and just call it from a field.

Read full topic

item.title: My loader :P won't start
item.dc:creator: @butzie225 butzie225
item.description:
@butzie225 wrote:

it load’s GUI but then it won’t start applet

[code]import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.applet.AppletStub;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLClassLoader;
import java.util.HashMap;

/**
*

  • @author Cody
    */
    public class Bot extends javax.swing.JFrame implements AppletStub {

    /** Creates new form Bot */
    public Bot(String world) {
    ourWorld = world;
    try {
    codeBase = new URL(“http://” + world + “.runescape.com”);
    documentBase = new URL(“http://” + world
    + “.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/”);

     loadApplet();
 initComponents(); }catch (Exception e) {
 	throw new RuntimeException(e);
 }

    }

    Applet loader;

    /**

    • This method is called from within the constructor to initialize the form.
    • WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is always
    • regenerated by the Form Editor.
      */
      public void loadApplet() throws Exception{
      try {
      URLClassLoader urlc = new URLClassLoader(new URL[] {
      new URL(“http://” + ourWorld + “.runescape.com/loader.jar”)
      });
      Class loaderClass = urlc.loadClass(“loader”);
      loader = (Applet) loaderClass.newInstance();
      } catch (Exception e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
      }
      }

    String ourWorld;
    URL codeBase;
    URL documentBase;

    private HashMap<String, String> loadParameters() {
    HashMap<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();
    parameters.put(“height”, “762”);
    parameters.put(“width”, “503”);
    parameters.put(“worldid”, “1”);
    parameters.put(“members”, “1”);
    parameters.put(“modewhat”, “0”);
    parameters.put(“modewhere”, “0”);
    parameters.put(“safemode”, “1”);
    parameters.put(“lang”, “0”);
    return parameters;
    }

    public URL getCodeBase() {
    return codeBase;
    }

    public URL getDocumentBase() {
    return documentBase;
    }

    public String getParameter(String s) {
    String parameter = loadParameters().get(s);
    if (s != null) {
    return parameter;
    }
    return “”;
    }

    public AppletContext getAppletContext() {
    return null;
    }

    public boolean isActive() {
    return true;
    }

    public void setActive(boolean isActive) {

    }

    public void appletResize(int x, int y) {
    }

    @SuppressWarnings(“unchecked”)
    //
    private void initComponents() throws Exception{

     jPanel1 = new javax.swing.JPanel();

 jPanel1.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(764, 502));
 setDefaultCloseOperation(javax.swing.WindowConstants.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
 javax.swing.GroupLayout jPanel1Layout = new javax.swing.GroupLayout(
 		jPanel1);
 jPanel1.setLayout(jPanel1Layout);
 jPanel1Layout.setHorizontalGroup(jPanel1Layout.createParallelGroup(
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING).addGap(0, 764,
 		Short.MAX_VALUE));
 jPanel1Layout.setVerticalGroup(jPanel1Layout.createParallelGroup(
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING).addGap(0, 503,
 		Short.MAX_VALUE));

 javax.swing.GroupLayout layout = new javax.swing.GroupLayout(
 		getContentPane());
 getContentPane().setLayout(layout);
 layout.setHorizontalGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING).addComponent(
 		jPanel1, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE,
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE,
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE));
 layout.setVerticalGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(
 		javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING).addGroup(
 		layout.createSequentialGroup().addComponent(jPanel1,
 				javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE,
 				javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE,
 				javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
 				.addContainerGap(58, Short.MAX_VALUE)));

 jPanel1.add(loader);
 loader.setStub(this);
 loader.init();
 pack();

    }//

    /**

    • @param args
    •        the command line arguments

    */
    public static void main(String args[]) {
    java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
    public void run() {
    new Bot(“world1”).setVisible(true);
    }
    });
    }

    // Variables declaration - do not modify
    private javax.swing.JPanel jPanel1;
    // End of variables declaration

}[/code]
